title: Cheers to the European Taxpayer
name: Cheers to the European Taxpayer
description:
A Map by Geoblogger

Mobile life and work of academic researchers on EU travel budgets. 

Places to stay, drink, look at, meet at.

properties.name: 1st FIDIS Doctoral Consortium
properties.description: Posted by GeobloggerRiezlernSkiing, hiking, meeting! Austria\'s mountains rock! In particular in Riezlern, where every German Univesity seems to have a seminar & guest house - strictly for educational purposes, of course!

properties.name: 2nd FIDIS Doctoral Consortium, Santorini
properties.description: Posted by GeobloggersantoriniAhh, Greek islands! The volcanic caldera of Santorini with its capial Fira is the perfect concerence and meeting location. Greek wine, dramatic cliffs, with Greek architecture on their tops, and Santorini Palace as a conference hotel. Excursions to the sunset in Ia, hiking a hot volcanic cone, scuba diving ... what else will you need?

properties.name: Bangkok, Thailand
properties.description: Posted by Mpoyserbangkokbangkok Thailand i loved it so much the first time i have been back on two seperate occasions.

properties.name: Catholic University of Leuven, Belgium
properties.description: Posted by GeobloggerleuvenLeuven is the most beautiful student town in Belgium! With its large university, you have enough chances for meeting, conference and workshop stay-overs. Don\'t miss the town hall square, the old market place (with its multi-floor beer pubs with NO closing hours) and the generous, affordable rooms in the nearby "Hotel Professor".

properties.name: French Silicon Valley
properties.description: Posted by GeobloggerCôte d\'Azur - Sophia AntipolisToo many meetings here... being a researcher, you cannot escape the charm of teh Côte d\'Azur! From Nice to Cannes, meetings follow meetings. Oh la la!

properties.name: Grand Hôtel les Mascareignes, Saint-Gilles-les-Baines, La Réunion, France DOM
properties.description: Posted by Geobloggersaint-gilles les bainsA fancy meeting location for people from Africa, Asia & Europe! The Grand Hotel is the best conference facility on the island. Food is French-Créole, standards are French-relaxed, environment is tropical. Amazing scenery (coral reefs, tropical forests, incredible canyons, 3000m summit, active volcano of Hawaii type). People call it the "French Hawaii".

properties.name: HP Labs Bristol
properties.description: Posted by GeobloggerBristol FiltonA leader in IT security research, HP labs in Filton regularly hosts meetings for the research community. The nearby Best Western Hotel provides with McDonalds and supermarkets. No scenery, though. Bristol downtown is cool, though, and buses go to great places in Wales within 2-3 hours. Try the Old Harbour pubs and the Welsh Penderyn Whisky!

properties.name: Haydau Monastry in Altmorschen, Germany
properties.description: Posted by GeobloggeraltmorschenThis former monastry and castle is now being used as a small conference center and exhibition location. Nearby guest houses provide lodging and food. Ideal location for workshops, project meetings, kick-offs and project reviews.

properties.name: Mozart
properties.description: Posted by Geoblogger BruxellesWell, Bruxelles is always a nice trip. I was recently hunting for research funding (what else to we researchers travel to Bruxelles for, anyway) when I checked into the Mozart hotel (http://www.hotel-mozart.be/). Affordable, right next to the Grand place, and quite out of the ordinary!

properties.name: PRIME Kick-Off Meeting, Brunnen
properties.description: Posted by GeobloggerswitzerlandBrunnen on a swiss mountain lake offers a professional hotel for decent conferences. The boat landing right in front offers conference trips on the tourist boat. Food is very well in Waldstätter Hof!
